title: How to Use the Chi Machine

steps.title: Drink a small glass of water before using the Chi Machine.
steps.content: Drink a small glass of water before using the Chi Machine.

steps.title: Position the Chi Machine on a firm surface with the handle facing away.
steps.content: Position the Chi Machine on a firm surface with the handle facing away. Make sure there is room underneath the machine for air movement.

steps.title: Stretch out your lower back, then lay down on the floor.
steps.content: Stretch out your lower back, then lay down on the floor. If you have low back or knee pain, place a pillow underneath your knees for extra support until your body becomes accustomed to the movement.

steps.title: Center your body with the arrow and place your legs on each side of the machine.
steps.content: Center your body with the arrow and place your legs on each side of the machine.

steps.title: Position your legs on the cradle so that the back of your calf rests on the cradle just above the ankle bone.
steps.content: Position your legs on the cradle so that the back of your calf rests on the cradle just above the ankle bone. Make sure the ankle bone is about 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) over the edge of the cradle so your feet can move freely back and forth.

steps.title: Position your arms.
steps.content: Position your arms. There are a few variations you can try: Stretched Back Position: Place both arms above your head and keep them as straight as possible. This may assist with weight loss, shoulder tendinitis, releasing muscle tension, and releasing nervous pressure. Mid Position: Place both hands under your head in a position that results in your upper body and legs being slightly lifted off the floor. Goldfish Position: Place both arms at your sides on the floor.

steps.title: Turn the timer switch on to activate the machine.
steps.content: Turn the timer switch on to activate the machine. First time users should not do more than 2-3 minutes. If your are in poor health, use less than 1 minute. Increase the time in 2 minute increments once your body has adjusted to the movement. Use of the machine twice a day provides maximum benefits.

steps.title: Stay relaxed and allow your body to move with the swing of the machine.
steps.content: Stay relaxed and allow your body to move with the swing of the machine. The machine provides a full body movement.

steps.title: Breathe deeply and evenly during the movement.
steps.content: Breathe deeply and evenly during the movement. Breathe in to the count of 7, hold to the count of 4, and exhale from the abdomen to the count of 8. The timing of each breath is not as important as the rhythm of the breathing.

steps.title: Remain on the floor for 2-3 minutes before getting up after the machine stops.
steps.content: Remain on the floor for 2-3 minutes before getting up after the machine stops. If necessary, remove your feet from the cradle during this time.

steps.title: Stretch out your spine and hips, then roll to one side and get up off the floor.
steps.content: Stretch out your spine and hips, then roll to one side and get up off the floor.

steps.title: Drink a full glass of water.
steps.content: Drink a full glass of water.
